interface.name: .NET Core Runtime
interface.summary: modular and high performance implementation of .NET

interface.name: .NET Framework
interface.description: This feed uses the version of .NET Framework already installed on the computer. It does not download new versions.

interface.name: .NET Framework Client Profile
interface.summary: subset of the .NET Framework optimized for client applications
interface.description: This feed uses the version of .NET Framework already installed on the computer. It does not download new versions.

interface.name: Common Language Runtime (CLR)
interface.description: Virtual feed for .NET implementations: .NET Framework on Windows and Mono on POSIX. Uses .NET Framework profiles as version numbers.

interface.name: Common Language Runtime (CLR) with MONO_PATH support
interface.summary: virtual feed for .NET implementations with MONO_PATH support
interface.description: Virtual feed for .NET implementations with MONO_PATH support: .NET Framework with monopath-emulator on Windows and Mono on POSIX. Uses .NET Framework profiles as version numbers.

interface.name: DocFX
interface.summary: documentation generation tool for API reference and Markdown files
interface.description: DocFX generates Documentation directly from source code (.NET, RESTful API, JavaScript, Java, etc...) and Markdown files.

interface.name: IronPython
interface.description: IronPython is an implementation of the Python programming language running under .NET/Mono and Silverlight/Moonlight. It supports an interactive console with fully dynamic compilation. It's well integrated with the rest of the .NET Framework and makes all .NET libraries easily available to Python programmers, while maintaining compatibility with the Python language. There also is Visual Studio tooling integration.

interface.name: Mono
interface.summary: open-source cross-platform implementation of the Common Language Runtime (.NET Framework compatible)

interface.name: NAnt
interface.description: NAnt is a free .NET build tool. In theory it is kind of like make without make's wrinkles. In practice it's a lot like Ant.
